YouTube user Elman511 cracked open an over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens. He found a standard-sized egg inside, along with yolk and white. The unusual occurrence is down to a counter-peristalsis contraction. This is when a second oocyte is released by the hen's ovary before the first egg has traveled through the oviduct. US researchers claim that exact prices of goods on eBay attract higher offers than round numbers. Items with precise prices attract higher offers than those with round numbers. Researchers at Wisconsin University in Madison analysed gibbons' songs. They found gibbons produce a variety of soft call types, known as 'hoos' Predator 'hoo's are produced at frequencies below the threshold of hearing for eagles and other birds of prey. This suggests the quiet calls were designed to alert other gibbons nearby.

Greenstone is a small egg-shaped gadget that acts like a beacon, or a beacon. It helps messages move around the so-called wireless mesh networks. It uses a feature that launched in iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework. It creates a wireless mesh network that connects phones to each other. It lets users users send messages to people in close proximity that are in Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct. But there are limits to how far a message can travel in this way.

One-Touch-911 app was designed by researchers at Boston-based MIT. It works with emergency dispatchers in 135 countries. Each call is placed with GPS location, user details and medical information attached. If the user doesn't have signal on their network, the app lets them 'roam' onto another network. Once connected, the caller doesn't have to speak as the majority of the information is sent automatically.

Researchers in Tokyo, noted that rats flatten their ears and narrow their eyes when they are in pain. They also puff up their cheeks when they are in pain. To test the rodents' response to rats' pained expressions, they showed them the photos in a specially made cage. They found that rats spent less time in the room showing rodents in pain than in the other compartment showing rats with neutral expressions.
